resources.string: • In 2013, 743 people died in bicycle-related accidents. \n• When you are biking, always watch out for cars!
Try out these brainteasers to challenge your mind! Press on the image to see the answer.

• Every two minutes a person is injured in a drunk driving accident. \n• See the drunk driving simulation machine!

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Step forward with your right leg and bend it 90 degrees. Make your left knee almost touch the ground. Balance your weight. Raise your arms straight up over your head, keeping them shoulder-width apart. Repeat with other leg.

Begin with hips and hands apart. Your hips should be over your knees and your shoulders over your wrists. Walk your hands a few inches in front of your shoulders. Straighten your legs. Push into your palms to draw energy into your lower body and to help elevate your pelvis. Your body will form an upside-down V.

With the growing population of fast food chains and busy schedules for people to make a healthy meal and exercise, the temptation to eat junk food is greater than ever. Keeping your body in shape is essential in maintaining a healthy lifestyle.
Sanitizing and washing frequently, especially in public places, help prevent catching diseases and bacteria from other areas. This helps decrease the chances of you getting sick.
• Lightning kills about 39 people each year. \n• Avoid being in open areas and get out of the water to prevent lightning strikes!
Stand with your feet together. Relax your shoulders and neck. Let your arms relax along your sides, and face your palms to the front.

1. About how many US adults suffer from obesity? 

A. One-third 
B. One-fourth 
C.Two-thirds 
D. One-half
A. About one-third of US adults suffer from obesity. \nThat is about 78.6 million people, and the rate is continuing to grow.

2. Which of the following are health problems associated with obesity? 

A. Heart Attack 
B. Stroke 
C. Hypertension 
D. All of the above

D. All of those choices are health risks of obesity. \nIncreased weight causes strain on a person’s arteries which causes them to suffer these illnesses and possibly die from preventable death causes.

3. Which of the following foods gives the highest source of protein? 

A. Beans 
B. Tuna 
C. Tofu 
D. Milk

B. Tuna is the highest source of protein from the list above. \nIt is also one of the highest sources of protein of any food that you can eat along with salmon and snapper, which have 22 grams in a 3 ounce filet - that is about 1 gram per 4.5 calories!

4. Which of the following exercises burns the most calories per hour? 

A. Zumba 
B. Jump Rope 
C. Cycling 
D. Aerobics
C. Cycling provides the best cardio exercise to burn calories. \nIf a person cycles for one hour they have the capacity to burn up to 1000 calories!

5. For the average adult, what is the healthiest heart rate to have? 

A. 60-100 bpm 
B. 40-60 bpm 
C. Above 100 bpm 
D. Below 40 bpm
A. 60-100 bpm is the average, healthy heart rate for an adult. \nBradycardia is a slowed heart rate below 60 bpm, and Tachycardia is a fast-paced heart rate about 100 bpm.
• About half of all shark attacks in the US take place in Florida. \n• Look for the Tiger, Blacktip, Lemon, and Bull sharks in Florida.

Strength is not limited to physical aspects; it also includes mental strength. Daily exercise and practice reinforces strength, and it is important to work out your body and brain for a healthier life.
